org.diirt.support.ca

Class JCADataSourceConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diirt.datasource.DataSourceConfiguration<JCADataSource>
      • org.diirt.support.ca.JCADataSourceConfiguration

  • public final class JCADataSourceConfiguration
extends DataSourceConfiguration<JCADataSource>
    Configuration for JCADataSource. This object is mutable and not thread-safe.
    Author:
    carcassi

      • read

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration read(InputStream input)
        Description copied from class: DataSourceConfiguration
        Reads the configuration from the given stream and returns an object with the new configuration.

        NOTE: whether this object is modified and returned, or a new object is returned, is currently unspecified.

        Specified by:
        read in class DataSourceConfiguration<JCADataSource>
        Parameters:
        input - the configuration file to be read
        Returns:
        the object with the new configuration

      • jcaContextClass

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration jcaContextClass(String className)
        The class name for the implementation of JCA.

        Default is JCALibrary.CHANNEL_ACCESS_JAVA.

        Parameters:
        className - the class name of the jca implementation
        Returns:
        this

      • jcaContext

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration jcaContext(gov.aps.jca.Context jcaContext)
        The jca context to use. This allows complete customization of the jca context.

        By default, will be automatically created from the jcaContextClass(java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        jcaContext - the context
        Returns:
        this

      • monitorMask

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration monitorMask(int monitorMask)
        The mask used for the monitor notifications. This should be a combination of Monitor.VALUE, Monitor.ALARM, ...

        Default is Monitor.VALUE | Monitor.ALARM .

        Parameters:
        monitorMask - the monitor mask
        Returns:
        this

      • typeSupport

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration typeSupport(JCATypeSupport typeSupport)
        Changes the way JCA DBR types are mapped to types supported in pvamanger.

        Default includes support for the VTypes (i.e. JCAVTypeAdapterSet).

        Parameters:
        typeSupport - the custom type support
        Returns:
        this

      • dbePropertySupported

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration dbePropertySupported(boolean dbePropertySupported)
        Whether a separate monitor should be used for listening to metadata changes.

        Default is false.

        Parameters:
        dbePropertySupported - if true, metadata changes will trigger notification
        Returns:
        this

      • varArraySupported

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration varArraySupported(boolean varArraySupported)
        If true, monitors will setup using "0" length, which will make the server a variable length array in return (if supported) or a "0" length array (if not supported). Variable array support was added to EPICS 3.14.12.2 and to CAJ 1.1.10.

        By default it tries to auto-detected whether the client library implements the proper checks.

        Parameters:
        varArraySupported - true will enable
        Returns:
        this

      • rtypValueOnly

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration rtypValueOnly(boolean rtypValueOnly)
        If true, for fields that match ".*\.RTYP.*" only the value will be read; alarm and time will be created at client side. Version of EPICS before 3.14.11 do not send correct data (would send only the value), which would make the client behave incorrectly.

        Default is false.

        Parameters:
        rtypValueOnly - true will enable
        Returns:
        this

      • honorZeroPrecision

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration honorZeroPrecision(boolean honorZeroPrecision)
        If true, the formatter returned by the VType will show no decimal digits (assumes it was configured); if false, it will return all the digit (assumes it wasn't configured).

        Default is true.

        Parameters:
        honorZeroPrecision - whether the formatter should treat 0 precision as meaningful
        Returns:
        this

      • addContextProperty

        public JCADataSourceConfiguration addContextProperty(String name,
                                                     String value)
        Adds a new property that is passed directly to the JCALibrary when creating the context.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property
        value - the value of the property
        Returns:
        this
